nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.evolution.operators.recombination

Class LinearCrossover<TProgram,TOutput extends Output<TProgram>,TTarget extends Target<? extends TProgram>>

  • RecombinationOperator
    • nz.co.jedsimson.lgp.core.evolution.operators.recombination.LinearCrossover<TProgram,TOutput,TTarget>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module

    public class LinearCrossover<TProgram,TOutput extends Output<TProgram>,TTarget extends Target<? extends TProgram>>
extends RecombinationOperator

    A class RecombinationOperator that implements Linear Crossover for two individuals.

    For more information, see Algorithm 5.1 from Linear Genetic Programming (Brameier, M., Banzhaf, W. 2001).

    See Also:
    class RecombinationOperator

    • Constructor Detail

      • LinearCrossover

        public LinearCrossover(@NotNull
                       EnvironmentFacade<TProgram,TOutput,TTarget> environment,
                       int maximumSegmentLength,
                       int maximumCrossoverDistance,
                       int maximumSegmentLengthDifference)

        A class RecombinationOperator that implements Linear Crossover for two individuals.

        For more information, see Algorithm 5.1 from Linear Genetic Programming (Brameier, M., Banzhaf, W. 2001).

        Parameters:
        maximumSegmentLength - An upper bound on the size of the segments exchanged between the individuals.
        maximumCrossoverDistance - An upper bound on the number of instructions between the two chosen segments.
        maximumSegmentLengthDifference - An upper bound on the difference between the two segment lengths.
        See Also:
        class RecombinationOperator

    • Method Detail

      • combine

        public void combine(@NotNull
                    Program<TProgram,TOutput> mother,
                    @NotNull
                    Program<TProgram,TOutput> father)

        Combines the two individuals given by exchanging two segments of instructions.

        Parameters:
        mother - The first individual.
        father - The second individual.
